snippet: An investigation into work on the $3.2 billion Croton water treatment plant, has uncovered crimes that are expected to lead to criminal charges, people with knowledge of the case said.
abstract: Investigation into work on $3.2 billion Croton water treatment plant in the Bronx, one of city’s largest public works projects, uncovers fraud and other crimes that are expected to lead to criminal charges against two men, and a deferred prosecution agreement; inquiry found fraud schemes involving Schlesinger-Siemens Electrical, company that was controlled by German engineering conglomerate Siemens AG.
lead_paragraph: An investigation into work on the $3.2 billion Croton water treatment plant, has uncovered crimes that are expected to lead to criminal charges, people with knowledge of the case said.

headline.seo: Bronx Plant Is Said to Be Under Fraud Inquiry
headline.main: Inquiry Is Said to Find Fraud at Bronx Water Plant
headline.print_headline: Water Plant Is Said to Be Under Inquiry
